content.description: This route face climbs up near the arete right of the striking dihedral of Private Idaho.  Fun steep climbing past the first two bolts lead to easier and lower angled rock.
content.protection: 3 older bolts with leeper hangers.  Assorted small to medium cams to make a belay.  Walk off east and then down past Private Idaho.

content.description: Thin crack in a white dihedral
content.location: Clean white dihedral on the west side of B52 rock

content.description: This fun hand and finger crack climbs much better than it looks from afar.  Decent rock and good moves with nice exposure.
content.protection: Light rack stoppers to 2-1/2" CD and one bolt.  Bolted belay/rappel anchor.  Single rope rappel
content.location: This right slanting crack is on the west face across from the prominent Private Idaho dihedral.

content.description: This is a fun thin slab climb easily top roped after climbing Brain Surgery.  Face climb up and right along a thin flake past a bulge, move back left at small roof to a another crack.
content.protection: Top rope with small to medium sized cams.
content.location: This route is in the middle of the northwest slab.  It starts at an obvious right leaning thin flake/crack.

content.description: A short slab route with nice positive holds up to the bolt, crux above.  ~Fun~
content.protection: One good bolt and maybe a couple small cams above.  Small to medium cams for gear belay.  Short easy walk off to the west.
content.location: This route is the left most climb on a small low angle slab, northeast of Love Shack.  It faces north.

climbs.name: Fine Line Between Genius and Insanity
climbs.fa: Mark Uphus and Sue Williams, December 1994

content.description:
I enjoyed leading this route and thought the name was pretty appropriate.

Thin slab climbing up and right past a bolt leads to a small roof and a welcomed jug.  Fiddle in some un-inspiring little gear in a thin rotten seam and pull the roof to jugs.

Ground fall potential getting to and surmounting the roof.
content.protection: One bomber bolt, small brass nuts and couple small tcu's.  With all that gear, you should be able to find something up there if you fiddle about long enough.  Small to medium cams for gear belay.
content.location: This is the right most route on the northwest slab with one obvious bolt.  Walk off to the west.

climbs.name: Breaking Bad
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Frank Bentwood, March 2014

content.description:
A steep face climb with a variety of interesting and cool moves.

Start 30 feet right of Love Shack and climb a slab past 2 bolts, then up through flakes to a bulge with a third bolt (crossing Love Shack at this point). Move left and climb a short headwall past 2 more bolts to the top.
content.protection:
5 bolts, plus a couple CDs from 1.5 to 2.5 inches

2-bolt anchor (80 ft. rappel)
